noun.description: Attributive and in the genitive. Designating a number expressing the proportion of volatile, water-soluble fatty acids present in butter and other fats and oils; (also) (now chiefly historical) designating a procedure for determining this proportion.

origin: Late 19th century. From the name of Emil Reichert, German food chemist, who developed such a procedure, published in Zeitschr. f. analyt. Chem 18 68.
